Reviews.Title: “Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: TDM2012
Reviews.Content: Was there for a conference. Location was good. Price excellent. Best part is the friendly service. Rainbow is always smiling. Rooms were clean and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “nothing wrong here”
Reviews.Author: jaywucherer
Reviews.Content: it's a travelodge not a hilton, but comfy and friendly staff. places nearby to get snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Comfort for Your Money”
Reviews.Author: Pearl R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lions Gate Travelodge for 5 nights in January 2012. I commend them for their comfortable, clean quiet rooms. The staff are excellent with all the help they offer their guests. We had medical appointments in North Vancouver and found the location excellent. Thoroughly enjoyed the ammenities at Park Royal. We will definitely be staying again and recommend highly to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: naveenkr
Reviews.Content: I and my friends planned to stay more time in vancouver and we shifted from Hyatt to Travelodge Vancouver Lion's Gate hotel for cheaper ( or cheapest :) ) accommodation. Hotel rooms were average but cozy. The rooms were so closely attached, we could hear all activity in the neighboring room :).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: motherbean
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a few nights while my wife was having some surgery done at Lions Gate Hospital. Their rates were great and the hotel was in a great location. They were doing some construction near the lobby but I hardly noticed. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and clean comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Familybarcello
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband and our 11 year old son stayed here for 5 nights on our way to Mexico and loved it. The staff at the front desk were super nice and helpful they made our trip unforgettable. The cleaning staff were very polite and friendly. Also very comortable beds we had the best sleep as the rooms are away from the main street so we were never disturbed by any noises.. our room also had the view of the mountains covered by snow which was amazing. We Booked this hotel because of the price, they have the best rates compared to the other hotels around and it totally exceeded our expectations! It is very convinient my son and husband like to sky so we took the bus and we were up on the grouse mountain within 15 minutes and we were there the whole day, the view was spectacular. There is a bus stop right beside the hotel which we took daily to go downtown and it only took 10minutes.. We also had breakfast at dennys next door every morning, they gave us a 20% off discount because of staying at this hotel which was also a great advantage.. Delicious pancakes!! We had dinner one night at earls next door and really enjoyed the food.. Great steak!! We will deffinitely come back, we miss Vancouver already!!

Reviews.Title: “First Stop”
Reviews.Author: 4CRPG
Reviews.Content: We try and make this Travelodge our first stop on our visits to see our grand children in Alberta. This is a perfect location for anyone in North Vancouver, restaurants, shopping, buses, and great parking. The hotel is QUIET with friendly staff. Great rates. As of October 2011, the hotel was is in the process of upgrading. No work was done at night when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff were unhelpful and lied to me”
Reviews.Author: ArunjeetSingh2
Reviews.Content: Lets start from the beginning. First, the central reservation line for Travelodge made a mistake and booked me one smoking and one non-smoking room instead of two non-smoking rooms. I caught this while confirming the reservation and was told that I had booked a non-changeable rate and should talk to the hotel to have the booking modified. I promptly called up the hotel and fixed the issue (or so I thought). They asked me to pay extra to have the reservation switched which I agreed to. The day I showed up I was told that only one of the rooms I had booked was ready and the other one was going to be cleaned soon. I confirmed that both rooms wer non-smoking and asked them to take their time and get the cleaning right. I then checked into the first room (which was non-smoking). Getting the second room took three phone calls to the front desk and about 90 minutes. The rest of my family checked into the second room outside of which there was NO non-smoking sign. I figured that didn't mean anything but the next morning we found out that the bathroom in the "smoking" room smelled of cigarette smoke. I was told , very rudely, by the front desk staff that they wouldn't be arguing the point with me when I pointed out that I was given a smoking room when I clearly booked a non-smoking one. How could I tell for sure that it was a smoking room? Because it did not have a non-smoking sign and the bathroom was filled with the smell of smoke. All this despite me waiting patiently for about an hour and a half while the room could be cleaned before check in. Tardiness I can tolerate, lying on the other hand is unacceptable. Will never stay at this place again. I'd advise you to do the same unless you can abide by their lies. There's a place called Grouse Inn next door which looked nicer. I'll probably try that out the next time I visit. I did stay at another Travelodge in Victoria and the experience was excellent. Something I've come to expect from Travelodge hotels. This place seems like an exception.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelodge_11
Reviews.Content: We booked online through a discount website. We booked a non smoking room. When we checked in we were put in a smoking room. When we asked for a non smoking room, we were told we could make a switch for a non smoking room for the full price. The toilet did not flush. It swirled around and then the water leaked out leaving us with raw sewage for our "four" nights stay. The third day we were late leaving the room and room cleaning service passed us by. I made a special trip to the front desk to make sure we wer not overlooked for room service. I was assured room service was until 5:30pm and that our room would be cleaned. It was not. The front desk made no effort to check to see we were not passed over. The room was dirty and smoky. So, if you stay there take several bottles of febreze for the air. The beds are old and the matresses sag. Use the fabreze on everything, the curtains, bed cover, the floor. The rooms are not worth the full price, but be aware you will not get the room you asked for on a discount website.

Reviews.Title: “A steal for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: aliila
Reviews.Content: We booked it via Hotwire and got a somewhat decent price for a room, but hotels in Vancouver are generally overpriced. The room had a warm and cozy atmosphere to it, very inviting. North Vancouver is a mere 20-minute drive from downtown Vancouver in the lower mainland, but it feels that much more tranquil and closer to nature.

Reviews.Title: “seemed a little run down”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryTravler86
Reviews.Content: it was an alright stay the room seemed a little run down. The stay started off really wrong, the doors were locked when we arrived at 7 o'clock in the evening and there was no one around at the reception desk. Once we got into the room things kind of improved a bit but....the safe in the room said that it had difficulties locking and was therefor disabled, so if you require a safe while traveling this is not the hotel for you.The shower pressure was really great and the water was warm but the shower it's self was a little dark and kind of sketchy. the tile floor looked unfinished and the drain looked dirty. The pillows super small but the bed was comfortable. There were very few plugs in the room so if you have electronics that need to be charged I would not recommend this hotel. I would stay there again as a last resort. The room was quiet and we couldn't hear our neighbors, I guess you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth for what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: MontrealBen
Reviews.Content: We paid almost $100 per night but the hotel is more like motel, not very well maintained. It's loud at night

Reviews.Title: “This "Gem" Sparkles !”
Reviews.Author: MJS062
Reviews.Content: If your Boss tells you to find a "Cheap" room, this is it! Cheap stops with the price. The rooms are not cheaply done. As a matter of fact, there is presently a "Renovation Program" in effect, so you can ask for a "Renovated Room" and be "Totally Satisfied". I stayed for 6 nights, and found the Denny"s Restaurant next door had excellent food. There's also an Asia food Restaurant on the same property. Unfortunately, I only ate once at Earl"s Restaurant next door in the west side of the property on my last night. The beef Steak was the best I ever had and the "Eye Candy" was exceptional! -------- Motel was easy to find and had staff that "Cares" MS Saskatoon

Reviews.Title: “Great expectations”
Reviews.Author: 9__Escape_Artist__9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner and some family in december, and we were greatly impressed by the staff, rooms, and the convenience of this location. I've stayed in quite a few Travelodge, and a lot of chain hotels in general, and I found that the staff here were very helpful, very friendly and personable. Granted, while this is not the Waldorf Astoria, it more than exceeds any expected value for your money. Our room was well outfitted, clean, and with a large bathroom! If you're looking for a place near downtown Vancouver, but don't want to have to deal with the craziness of staying downtown, this is the spot for you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel with great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaBells
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two night while visiting family in Vancouver over Christmas. The room was spacious, clean and the bed was super comfortable. However, I think what made this stay exceptional, was the customer service. Everyone from the woman at the front desk, the housekeeper, to the manager were beyond friendly and made us feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great prices, clean, simple and plain, but great value near the city.”
Reviews.Author: Peachlandtraveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the NV Travelodge twice now. You can't beat the internet prices, but don't expect this to be a Las Vegas Hotel, it's not. It's an older Motel, but it's clean, convenient and easy access to Grouse Mountain, the North Shore and Vancouver. I booked based on price, and was happy. The bed was decent, the room was older but very clean and the lady at the front desk was a sweety and very polite. I ticked the box for a restaurant, but there isn't one. However there is a Denny's right next door and the motel offers a coupon for a deal on food there. While Denny's is pretty simple food, hey, a deal's a deal, right?

Reviews.Title: “I've never written a bad review before, but....”
Reviews.Author: Duettist96
Reviews.Content: I cannot work out what went wrong here, having read the other reviews. Our room was not very clean, BOTH of the rooms were smoking rooms ( I thought that was illegal in N America/Canada? ), which apparently can happen if you book through Expedia. They DID spray them both with air fresheners, as they were full and couldn't move us, but it was noisy, dingy, one of the lights didn't work, the bathroom was not very clean - it was only one night, so it didn't matter, but on a 17-night road trip this was the worst place we stayed at. By some way.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: mdtravelling
Reviews.Content: We were in Vancouver for a quick overnight and looking for a reasonably priced place for the night near the cruise ship port. The Lions Gate Travelodge fit that need. Upon arrival we were somewhat surprised as our accommodations surpassed our expectations. Our room was dated and somewhat worn, but exceptionally clean with a comfortable bed and a AC that unit worked well without any excess noise so that we could use the fan at night for noise suppression, which as it turned out was unnecessary because t he place was pretty quiet. While they did not serve breakfast on site the 20% percent discount at the neighboring Denny’s provided what was likely a better meal. This Travelodge is one we would stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “icky & dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Carmen80132
Reviews.Content: There was a long wait to check in (they need more staff). We arrived late and needed to be out early or WE WOULD HAVE LEFT! There was HAIR IN THE SHOWER upon arrival! No elevator and NO BREAKFAST. The room was Ok otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Rip-off. AVOID.”
Reviews.Author: Kurt2010
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a day trip to Vancouver, so I booked a 2 double-bed room for myself, wife and son Saturday morning. When we arrived, around 8pm to check in, I was informed that the 2 double bed rooms were all gone (but then, what is the point of making and paying for a reservation?). The desk clerk told me she'd give me a king bed with a fold-out sofa at the same price, like it was a favor. The room was behind the lobby and seemed to be a converted storage area. The lighting was nauseating, like a storage facility. My wife opened a bar of soap and found a long hair inside - do they rewrap soap bars? The ceiling above the bed had industrial tape holding it together. The AC was badly damaged and lacking labels - I asked the desk clerk when she came by with a new bar of soap what the settings were, but not being very proficient in English, she couldn't really explain it to me. There was a sliding door, which opened to reveal some left over lumber and an industrial machine, further confirming that this room was once a storage unit. There were extension cords everywhere, as if it was someone's apartment. The bed was uncomfortable (I didn't want to fold out the sofa, since so much else was skeevy) And all this cost us only $136. For that kind of money, I'm sure I could've found better accommodations and for a bit more money a much better hotel class.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel, but what a bargain for Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripRoger
Reviews.Content: At first, the location is a little off-putting. The Travelodge sits on a tight little lot behind a Vietnamese restaurant and a Denny's, and if not for the big sign by the road, you would never know it is there. And yes, it is not a sparkling new hotel. But we paid just $79 per night, and for that it was a great deal. Furnishings were a little beat, but the room was clean. Internet worked flawlessly. In-room coffee, plus coffee on 24 hours a day in the lobby. No breakfast provided, but you do get a 20 percent discount at the Denny's. As for getting into Vancouver, you are right next to the Lions Gate Bridge, so it is an easy drive. Or you can grab the bus that passes every 10 minutes on Marine Drive and go to Lonsdale Quay to take the SeaBus across the bay. All in all we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Irishlad1984
Reviews.Content: This was my sceond visit to Vancouver and i decided to stay in North Vancouver because its the best location for attractions such as Capilano bridge, Grouse Mountain, Lynn Valley, Lonsdale Quay etc. The hotel was really nice. The rooms ticked all the boxes been clean and comfortable. The Receptionist was very helpful knowing every bus to get to all the different attractions . Also the 20% discount at Denys was a big bonus.

Reviews.Title: “An above-average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SDMRT
Reviews.Content: Compared to the other Travelodge properties I’ve stayed at - I would consider this one as better than most. This motel is well-located to the north of Vancouver across the Lions Gate Bridge. It is only a short walk from the motel to the bus stop which runs into Vancouver and connects to all of the tourist areas like Granville Island. The Horseshoe Bay ferry terminal is a short distance north on the coast highway. The motel staff are knowledgeable of the public transportation system. The rooms were clean and not crowded. The lighting was good. There were only two pillows - could have been more for the size of the bed. The bathroom was small and only held a shower - no tub. Internet was accessible. The room had a refrigerator, alarm clock, telephone and the front desk offered a wake-up phone call. There is a Denny’s and a Vietnamese restaurant next to the property which offer a 10% discount to motel guests. We ate take-out from the Vietnamese restaurant and it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Keeps Getting Better!!”
Reviews.Author: Tavelcritic
Reviews.Content: Haven't been to this hotel for over a year and they continue to renovate it. The hotel looks even better and the room I stayed in had new furniture and the bathroom was a delight compared to my previous stay. I would definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Dingy and cramped”
Reviews.Author: CCR1138
Reviews.Content: We booked two double rooms for our group of 5. Both were dingy, old, and in need of renovation. Although our rooms were clean, the carpets were stained, the bathroom tile was three different styles and colors that didn't match, the toilets weren't seated properly and rocked when you sat down, and the rooms were very cramped. There was no breakfast, although a Denny's with extremely slow servers is next door. There is no indoor place for people to gather (our group likes to play cards at night), so we ended up shoving a bed aside and using a table from the scorching hot uncovered patio upstairs. The outdoor pool is tiny but servicable. The staff are quite friendly and helpful -- it's not their fault the property is so run down. All in all, I wish we'd spent a bit more to stay someplace nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Budget Choice!”
Reviews.Author: SweetSeattleite
Reviews.Content: I called first to see if the renovations mentioned in another review were done, and they are. Even so, we had pretty low expectations, but they were blown away when we checked in and got into the room (which they even upgraded from a Queen to a King for free, since it was available). As far as I can tell, the renovations included new carpet, bedding, paint, and some furniture and fixtures. The room looks just like the pics on the site, smells just fine and is clean. The bathroom is small and in need of some help, but it's as good as possible for an old bath, clean and functional. Yeah, the furniture is dinged up a little, some of the stuff in the bathroom is discolored or loose, and the walls are kind of thin (we had partying neighbors in the adjoining room who either had a pet skunk or were smoking a good amount of pot...the sounds and smells did get through the wall and locked door), but it's pretty much a standard, clean, freshened-up 2-star hotel/motel room all around. We've stayed in other hotels all over the place that are about the same for triple or quadruple the price of this Travelodge room. I was concerned about the location, too, but it's actually pretty convenient for those with their own transportation and don't need to be downtown a lot. We're pretty happy to be a fairly short drive away from everywhere we want to go on this trip, including Lynn Canyon, Kits, Granville Island and Burnaby. In conclusion, the Lions Gate Travelodge isn't perfect, but it'll likely give you a great bang for your buck if the north side of the Lionsgate Bridge works for you, you understand there is definitely an older property under the recent remodel and you don't need tons of amenities and extras. If you scour the hotel's site and web, you might even be able to find an extraordinary deal (but book it when you find it, because they seem to go quickly!). This place isn't luxurious, particularly romantic, or problem-free, BUT it IS one of the more inexpensive hotels with free parking, good wifi, clean rooms and nice staff in a safe neighborhood (at least it seems that way) in the Greater Vancouver area. If you're looking for cheap and clean, it's worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible value”
Reviews.Author: islandshadow
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpful and wants to insure you have the best stay possible. The hotel is undergoing renos, and we stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms which was grand - the bed was great - slept like a baby. The proximity to the ferry is wonderful - and it's easy to get to - with a number of restaurants virtually on site they're so close. I was most impressed with the cleanliness, quietness and great, friendly staff. The price for what you get is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Picht
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the tourist information at Canada Pier. We arrived in Vancouver quite late and couldn't be bothered to check out different hotels. The photos we were shown on the hotel's internet page didn't look too bad either. The location of the hotel is ok - in North Vancouver only a short drive away from Capilano Bridge and Grouse Mountain tourist attractions. Next to that there is not much to see on Marine Drive. You can take a bus downtown (it doesn't run frequently especially at weekend evenings, so check before!). I recommend taking the seabus on at least one way - you will have a great view of the skyline. To the hotel itself: We were in for a nice surprise after the photos on the web. The room looked very worn and had a persistent mildewy smell that wouldn't go away even after some venting. In one corner there were some dusty cobwebs. Bathroom: The toilet handle broke after first usage. It was replaced fairly quickly, however the way the new one was attached we could only use it with utmost care. The shower looked more like something I was used to during my days in the army than a hotel shower. I recommend wearing flip-flops! There were traces of mildew in the corners but we almost expected that by now. The shower head was fixed and couldn't be moved either way. The water supply was plentiful and not just drip drops... at least one good thing. Breakfast: They do not offer breakfast but there is a Denny's around the corner. If you like that kind of food you can just walk over. Apparently you get a discount there as Travelodge guest - however nobody told us and I just found out by reading some of the other reviews here. Conclusion: the location is OK if cou do not require downtown accomodation and know when the busses are running. The choice of places for breakfast is limited. I would not recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: lys207
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to West Van on business and based on the reviews I had read I decided to book my 8 day stay at the Travelodge. I read reviews from a bunch of different sites and they all said that this place was ok. WRONG! It is nasty. We seriously checked out after 20 minutes of being there. It was so run down and disgusting. We ended up checking out the other hotels in the area and told them about why we had booked at the travelodge and they all said that the reviews are LIES. That they actually go on and write good reviews for themselves. DO NOT GO THERE. TRUST ME IT IS SO GROSS. The shower in our bathroom looked like a shower from a public swimming pool. DON'T GO IN WITHOUT FLIP FLOPS. Ya, that is how NASTY this place is. YUCK! YUCK! YUCK! If you are wanting to stay somewhere cheap just spend a little extra and stay at the Best Western Capilano Suites. It is so worth the money and they have weekly rates.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in downtown instead”
Reviews.Author: azrael211
Reviews.Content: We read previous reviews of this hotel and though it would be ok for visiting grouse mountain. Although the staff were helpful and friendly the area is not the best. The room was fairly dark and frankly a bit scary. The bathroom was extremely small and unpleasant - we have posted some candid photos. We would recommend staying else where or even in downtown vancouver and catching the ferry bus over to the northside.

Reviews.Title: “smell of meldew”
Reviews.Author: manika24
Reviews.Content: Smell of meldew was overwhelming - opened the door for awhile to get some air in. The room size was fine for one king bed with closet. The bathroom had a tub and shower in it. The windows and bars in the bathroom (for shower curtain and towels were awful covered in rust and some black paint. What is supposed to be a bath towel was the size of a larger hand towel. The refrigerator was leaking. For $130/night not worth it at all. The are other hotels on Capilano Rd newer and nicer for the same price. Great area if you go over the Lions gate bridge into West Vancouver - there is a mall with many restaurants. If you go east on Marine Dr - there is nothing interesting there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, nice room”
Reviews.Author: ojQj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at this travelodge. Pros: Good location, good service, nicely decorated rooms, discount cards for Denny's next door, good price. When we arrived, the friendly staff informed us of a fireworks show going on that evening. It was spectacular, so I was glad we didn't miss it. Cons: Small shower, no refrigerator Summary: Well worth the price. I prefered the discount card over the nasty breakfasts I've had at another Travelodge's.

Reviews.Title: “A Pig With Lipstick!”
Reviews.Author: emubird
Reviews.Content: Not worth the money! I stayed here two nights in two different rooms. The rooms I was in did not look anything like the ones in the photos. This is a old hotel in need of some serious remodeling. Walls had scuffs and dirt, bathrooms had mold and hair from lack of a through cleaning. One of the rooms had wet carpet from a leaking window or A/C unit. They have tried to dress it up a bit with new carpet and furniture. The bath towels were thin and about 2 ft square. Beds only came with 2 pillows and the bottom sheets were not fitted. Woke up sleeping in a bare mattress. The owners of this hotel have cut too many corners on the maintaince of this place. The staff was not friendly but not rude. The only thing this hotel has going for it is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet,Clean, Comfy !!!! Definitely NOT Disappointed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: familyescape
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two children for a couple of days in February. I booked the room on line (paying only $49CDN per night for the four of us) and was sent a response right away. I didn't expect much being a two star motel but I was most pleasantly surprised. Our room was nicely decorated with co-ordinating neutral tones, fluffy duvet style comforters, excellent comfy pillows. The motel is set amongst many others in the area but is the only one in that grouping that is not on a main road so it was quiet. The only down side was there was no bath which we did know in advance so I was prepared. It is an older style building but the bathroom was the only room that made that obvious. Our last stay was at a Best Western near Seatac before a flight to Mexico and I was kept up all night by the partiers in the room above, so I was very happy to have the top floor and noise from the neighbours on both sides was non-existant. Also the kids loved it. There was a water tower and small fridge which are great to have with kids and being a motel it is easy access to the car parked directly outside the door for all the stuff that you have to carry. It was a very handy location for access to downtown Vancouver, Stanley Park etc. There is a Denny's on one side (which gives you 20% off if you are staying at the motel) and an inexpensive Vietnamese noodle house on the other. I had read the reviews before I booked and most were positive and ours was too. I have since sent my mother and sister there and they enjoyed the experience too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money. Paper thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: theKiwi
Reviews.Content: Booked on Hotels.com for $60, so a great deal. Had low expectations, but this motel was OK. The room was a good size, and plenty of room for luggage. Many TV channels. Very close to Lions Gate Bridge. 24 hour Denny's is adjacent, and guests get 20% off meals. We got around by public transportation. many frequent buses to downtown and other locations. Close to Capilano Bridge and Stanley Park. I don't really have anything negative to say about the hotel. As mentioned above, the walls are paper thin, and we were treated to quite the audio show by our must've-been-honeymooning neighbors...oh dear.... Friendly staff yet they were quite unknowledgeable about city sightseeing. I would stay here again, because I'm cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great service - but confirm your reservation!”
Reviews.Author: kymberand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel for two separate nights in June. The first night there were four of us staying in two separate rooms, the second night three of us stayed in one room with two beds. Despite mixed reviews we booked the hotel for the location (a short drive to the Horseshoe Bay ferry, and short walk to the Lion's Gate bridge) and the price, which was 65 CAD per night for the rooms with one bed, 95 for the room with two. The motel appears to have been updated recently, because all of the rooms were quite nice with modern decorations, good beds with nice quilts. The room size varied from large to very large. The outside of the motel looks like an average roadside motel, and there are no elevators (only two floors) which can be a pain if you have a lot of luggage. As others have pointed out, this is not a hotel, so be aware of that when you book. However, as motels go we thought this was a very good place to stay. The entrance is a bit hard to find but if you're coming from the west (from the Lion's Gate bridge, Horseshoe Bay or Hwy 99) the hotel has a large billboard sign tell you which turns to make. Coming from the east we found it a bit harder to locate. It's right next to a Denny's. Be warned, however, that if you book online at the Travelodge website, the motel might not receive your reservation. The online website lists some rooms with queen beds, which the motel does not have (only kings and doubles). If you book one of these rooms, the motel might not receive the booking! We had booked two such rooms and they didn't have a record of either. However, the staff were extremely helpful and apologetic (apparently this has happened before) and manage to find rooms for us both nights. Probably it would be better to book rooms directly with the motel instead of through Travelodge. They were also very accomodating to our request to change one reservation for five people to four people, and another for four people to three people (even though it required changing rooms). Additionally they provided us with directions and information about everything we wanted to see/do in Vancouver. The location is about a 20-minute walk to Stanley Park across the Lion's Gate Bridge (which offers fantastic views of city, sea and mountains, particularly in the evening). If you don't want to walk though be warned that traffic congestion around the bridge can be pretty bad at certain times of the day.

Reviews.Title: “surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very nervous, but we were soo surprised. They just put in new carpets and beds. The decor is better than most hotel. Bathroom clean, but needs updating. Close to the attractions we needed.

Reviews.Title: “not again! once was enough...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not sound proof. TV and shower easily heard. No fridge even though it was mentioned in the description. Surly front desk in the morning. Complimentary newspaper was a tabloid trashy type. Pack em in and then shut up about it was the feeling I got about this hotel. For 74 u.s. dollars it wasn't even cheap or discount. We got lost finding the place went to west Vancouver instead of north Vancouver. It is near a Denny's and a noodle place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Travelodge!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked us into this Travelodge. At first I was apprehensive, Travelodge's in my area are not great. We needed to be close to the cruise terminal as we were taking a cruise to Alaska, and be near attractions. We spent half of what we would have in the city, got a new "mini suite". Loved it, Loved it. What a surprise. We enjoyed our room, clean, comfortable, and we enjoyed Grouse Mtn and Suspension Bridge near by. At the other end of Lions Gate bridge, 5 min to Stanley Park. Try this out, we saved ,and spent else where!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge Vancouver Lion's Gate
HotelInfo.Address: 2060 Marine Drive, Vancouver, British Columbia V7P 1V7, Canada
